intro: Scyphogyne rigidula var. breviciliata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved scyphogyne, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
